channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Outside burghley court (16-18 ingestre rd), 16th September
item.description:
The tree has grown back again over the last few years and is now touching most of the northern aspect of the top floor of the building and the north east corner of the building. I think it’s a Norwegian Maple tree- a total delight but I think better for the property if it’s trimmed back a bit as before. Many thanks for all your hard work. Much appreciated!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9, Ingestre Road, Tufnell Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: People sitting with barking dogs every night, 16th September
item.description:
A couple sit in this playground with a pair dogs that bark constantly all night. It’s obviously a disruptive noise and always happens at night for 2/3 hours a night
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Pownall Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Open manhole, 16th September
item.description:
This manhole cover is in Danson park by Danson house. It was not fixed down, I walked across it and slipped and went straight down it hurting my leg. The owner of chestnuts cafe in Danson house came out to help me and gave me ice and tried to cover the hole. I had little children with, this would have been extremely dangerous if one of them had fallen down the hole.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Danson Park, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Continued broken glass on pavement, 16th September
item.description:
Third time reporting same issue (previous references 8117709 and 8155810), cases get closed but nothing cleared. All broken glass still there from same broken bottle.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): De Beauvoir Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uneven paving. Paving stone sticking out, 16th September
item.description:
Whilst walking from London Zoo to Camden tube station, I fell and went flying head first into metal barriers that were dividing the road. I do not know the name of the road but I know that there was a weeping willow tree there and there was also pelican crossing there to cross the very busy road. The metal barriers, actually saved me, if it wasn't for them, I would have gone straight into the road and under a car or bus
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 64-70, Camden High Street, Chalk Farm, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Matrass dumped by lamppost close to communal bins on Innes Street, 16th September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Innes Street, Old Kent Road, London

item.title: Pothole on Moorgate going north at junction with London Wall in cycle box, 16th September
item.description:
At the front of the cycle box at the traffic lights on Moorgate going north at the junction with London Wall there is a large pothole next to a vent which makes it very dangerous for bikes starting to cycle with cars and buses close behind.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): London Wall, City of London
Report on FixMyStreet
